author: Andrea Thomas
title: Turkey Releases Journalist in Sign It Wants to Mend Ties with Germany
text:
BERLIN—A Turkish court on Friday released a prominent German-Turkish journalist from prison a year after his arrest, removing the biggest irritant in the two countries’ fraught relationship and adding to recent signs of a thaw.
The release of Deniz Yucel, which came even as four other journalists were sentence to life in prison, follows a meeting between German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Turkish prime minister in Berlin. Both pledged to work toward a rapprochement between the North Atlantic Treaty Organization allies.
